column1: Paladin Took I was a Hobbits of the Shire who held the position of Thain some time between  and .

There are no direct records of Paladin I but he was evidently the namesake of Paladin Took II. Paladin Is reign as Thain came between the beginning of the Took line of Thains in  and the reign of Isengrim Took II
column3: after which there were no gaps in the Took familys genealogy.

column1: A "wikipedia:Paladin" is a high office which existed in medieval Europe - which entered into many tales - and was noble office held by a honourable and valiant knight. In particular
column2: a paladin was one of the twelve peers of Charlemagnes court. The term comes from the Latin palatinus which means "of the palace".Jim Allan (ed.)
